thread.title: Kim

author: Kim
title: Kim
text: My persimmon tree came well packed but had a tiny root system with absolutely no fibrous roots. This may be because the tree was a bit older and the roots had to be pruned to fit the shipping container. I planted it immediately, so only time will tell whether it survives or not. It's still late February and the tree has not yet budded, so I'm giving it all the benefit of the doubt I can muster. A free replacement is a good guarantee, but if it means losing a year of growth, it's no bargain.
